conversation_id: "68a944bd-d61c-832d-885d-1ba65d9c5325" title: "Corporate payments cheat sheet" accounts: ["Account1_exports"] models: [] tags: [] message_count: 17

Corporate payments cheat sheet

user

system

system

2025-08-23T04:34:05.460000Z user

2025-08-23T04:34:06.919568Z assistant

Got your Corporate Payments Global deck. Want a quick, no-nonsense cheat sheet you can use while you work? Heres a one-pager you can keep open.

Corporate Procure-to-Pay (non-Retail) TL;DR

What counts

  • All non-inventory goods & services Amazon uses internally (Ops, Legal/HR/IT/Marketing, utilities, CAPEX, data center services, taxes/fees/settlements). Not Retail inventory or Marketplace. fileciteturn0file0

Who does what (fast map)

  • PO Owner: end-to-end owner; the bridge to vendor; confirms receipt/approves services.
  • Vendor Manager / Vendor Maintenance: get the vendor created/maintained in Payee Central.
  • FinOps Corp AP: processes invoices/payments per rules.
  • Support (Tax, Accounting, Legal, etc.): governance; help on edge cases. fileciteturn0file0

Golden rules (S&TP first!)

  1. Follow S&TP approvals/controllership before any commitment.
  2. Onboard the vendor in Payee Central (separate onboardings if vendor sells goods & services).
  3. Issue a PO (Coupa for corporate; SC.OS/Cloudforge for data centers).
  4. Vendor invoice must include the PO number and match the PO.
  5. Goods = 3-way match (receipt required); Services = 2-way & approval workflow.
  6. FinOps pays after receipt/approval; otherwise they open a TT describing the fix. fileciteturn0file0

Quick workflows

A) Standard PO flow

Contracting Vendor onboard (Payee Central) Create PO (correct supplier site, GL, org, location, type) Vendor invoices with PO #/line AP validates

  • Goods: you post receipt in Coupa/Cloudforge Pay
  • Services: you approve Oracle workflow email Pay. fileciteturn0file0

B) Blanket/recurring

Use Blanket PO for multi-month services/consumption; single PO for one-offs. Keep funds/lines aligned to expected billing cadence. fileciteturn0file0

Set-up essentials (when creating the PO)

  • Supplier number/site matches the vendors tax ID/branch.
  • Content group & GL string (company code, cost center, account).
    • Assets account 16999; Spare parts 14808; Expenses 6xxxx.
  • PO type: Goods = quantity/3-way; Services/Freight = amount/2-way.
  • Separate POs for fixed assets vs consumables. fileciteturn0file0

The five most common blockers (and how to clear them)

  1. QTY REC (Quantity Receipt) hold (Coupa): you forgot to receive. Find PO Truck icon receive correct qty/date. (Cloudforge: follow Receiving POs wiki.) fileciteturn0file0
  2. PO Overbilled / Max Ship Amount / Qty Ord: invoice > PO funds/qty. Add funds/lines in Coupa (Request change Add line/update), then Holds team re-matches. fileciteturn0file0
  3. Missing approval (Services): approve the Oracle workflow email (ofa-wf-prod@amazon.com). fileciteturn0file0
  4. Incorrect GL/location/supplier site: fix the PO or have vendor cancel and re-issue invoice; attach proof of cancellation in the TT. Never receive/approve if details dont match. fileciteturn0file0
  5. Vendor not registered: get them onboarded (Payee Central). Separate invites for goods and services if both. fileciteturn0file0

Do / Dont (rapid fire)

  • Validate gross price (incl. taxes/fees) before setting PO funds.
  • Keep vendor aligned on the exact PO # and line they must bill.
  • Use separate POs by product type (asset vs expense) to avoid GL defects.
  • Dont confirm receipt or approve services if anything doesnt matchrequest vendor cancellation within local deadlines and attach proof.
  • Dont forget services need approval; goods need receiptsno exceptions. fileciteturn0file0

Critical vendors (know when to escalate)

Utilities, telecom, rent/colo, employee benefitsanything where late/non-payment could halt buildings/ops, harm reputation, or disrupt sites/fulfillment. Government critical vendors may need NSQ flow with supporting docs. fileciteturn0file0

Coupa change ops youre allowed to make

Description (non-catalog), coding (not company code), attachments, match type, need-by date, unit price (amount-based), qty (qty-based), payment terms, close/re-open, ownership transfereach has a tutorial. fileciteturn0file0

Special cases youll see

  • Import of services: align PO currency to invoice currency; confirm withholding/tax rules before placing PO.
  • PAS / Pre-approved spend and exceptions: follow policy; some cases are PO-exempt, but GL reference still required. fileciteturn0file0

If you want, I can turn this into a printable mini-poster or a step-by-step checklist for your exact role (e.g., PO Owner on Ops services).

Amazon Corporate Procure-to-Pay

Agenda

Confidential

Whats included in Corporate Payments S&TP Who does What Complex Regulatory environment Vendor Onboarding Purchase Order Vendor Invoicing Confirmation, approval and payment Appendix

Most Common Issues and How to Solve Transaction types Useful Links Critical Vendors Other Vendor Onboard Methods and Importation of Services

Executive Summary. Things you must remember

Confidential

S&TP - Follow Amazons policy regarding contracting, approvals and controllership.

For Complex Regulatory environments - Pay attention to details (ex.: tax IDs for vendor and Amazon, invoice cancellation rules)

Vendor Onboarding All vendors onboarded is the 1st step. Required by country (for specific tax interview), with separated onboards for goods and services

Purchase Order Ensure the correct vendor code, correct Amazon taxID, description, amount and quantity with taxes, 1 PO per product type or services

Vendor Invoicing There are countries where vendor is required to email invoice pdf to Amazon and invoice must have PO number. The invoice must match the PO. Check with your local AP/BP partner for country specific rules

Confirmation, approval and payment - Receipt (Goods) or Approval (Services) is required. If all checks passed, FinOps will schedule payment. If not, FinOps opens a ticket with actions/fixes required by vendor or by PO requester.

Most Common Issues and How to Solve Summary guide on how to respond to FinOps TTs (slides 29-37)

Confidential

If you mean RETAIL Purchases (inventory that will be sold by amazon.com), this is NOT your place!

If you mean CORPORATE Purchases (Goods or Services that will be used internally) OR Datacenter purchases... This is the right place!

NEED TO BUY ON BEHALF OF AMAZON BRAZIL?

What is included in Corporate Payments

Confidential

All goods and services for Amazon as final user

Includes:

All non-inventory items used internally (such as office and shipping supplies)

Services covering Fulfillment Centers, Transportation and other services related to Operations

Services for diverse Corporate purposes, such as Legal, Marketing, HR and IT advisors, intermediary and infrastructure services

Taxes, bank charges, fines & penalties, legal settlements

Essencial site services as water, energy, telecom (Critical Vendors)

Fixed assets (CAPEX)

Services related to datacenters, digital, music and video (content creators, producers, partners)

Does NOT include:

Inventory items that will be sold by Amazon

Marketplace purchases (3P)

Every Transaction has ONE PURPOSE and SEVERAL IMPACTS

Confidential

THE PURPOSE

A service to be provided for our Business

A maintenance item

An input for our Operations

An asset for our Launches

A critical service

expansions

operations

suppliers quality financials

business efficiency

sales

THE IMPACTS

First Things First - The Spending & Transaction Policy

Confidential

The purpose of this policy is to ensure that all transactions are properly approved, contracted for, and in the best overall interests of Amazon. Prior to agreeing to any transaction (even if no expenditure is involved) and before initiating or requesting any payment to or from a third party, you must complete or comply with the approvals and controllership described in the Policy.

Roles & Responsibilities Who Does What?

Confidential

PO Owner - Responsible for the Order inclusion and specific purchase management end to end. In case there is any issue with the PO or the invoice, the PO Owner is the bridge between Amazon and the vendor.

Vendor Manager Responsible for the Vendor registration, administration and contact

Vendor Maintenance Responsible for the Vendor creation, maintenance and administration

FinOps Corp AP Responsible for performing transactions within AP based on the predetermined rules.

Corporate Support Functions Responsible for providing technical support and guideline for Corp AP and Businesses.

  • International Tax
  • Accounting
  • Legal
  • Taskless Tax
  • Tax Compliance

FinOps BP Support the operating effectiveness, connecting Business/Corporate with FinOps AP

Vendor Onboard: Basic Steps (1 of 3)

The Vendor Onboard is necessary for ALL countries via Payee Central. The standard payment terms is 60 days.

Check if the Vendor already exists in Amazon Payee Central. Click on the link: https://w.amazon.com/index.php/GFS/VPS/SSC/UserGuide/PayeeManagement#How_do_I_find_a_supplier

If the Vendor does not exist in Payee Central, then Vendor Onboard is required. Vendor Managers are responsible for sending the invitation to the Vendors.

Payee Central Scope referral https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/Payee_Central/Payee_Central_Current_Scope_Matrix/

Foreign Vendors: of a vendor has already onboarded at any other Amazon country, they will have to onboard again to submit to the specific country tax interview

If your Vendor will supply both SERVICES and GOODS, two separated onboard invitations are required. When creating the PO, the corresponding Supplier Code must be used for that specific purchase.

https://w.amazon.com/index.php/GFS/VPS/SSC/UserGuide/PayeeManagement#How_do_I_find_a_supplier https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/Payee_Central/Payee_Central_Current_Scope_Matrix/

  1. PO DETAILS

Supplier number: refer to the exact Vendor TAX ID/Branch(correct TAX ID, fully onboarded) review the correct supplier code, ensure to select the correct supplier site

Amazon Content Group: double check your organization Amazon Location (identified in the GL String) Service or goods description: exactly match the described in the invoice GL String: matching location, org and cost center. Reach out to your Finance POC Fixed Assets x Consumable Goods need separated POs Product type (assets, spare parts, expense) or service needs to match the GL string: Company codes (4R, MG, 5B, MN, B903, B868) GL String Account Code 16999 to indicate Assets GL String Account Code 14808 to indicate Spare Parts GL String Account Code that begins with 6XXXX indicate Expenses PO type: Goods: PO must be 3-way match and quantity-based Services or Freights: PO must be 2-way match and amount-based

Confirmation, Approval and Payment

Confidential

Confirmation, Approval and Payment (1 of 3) https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/SA-AP.aspx

GOODS: 3-Way match The PO Owner is responsible for confirming that the item was received and there is match between the ordered and received material. COUPA: https://broadcast.amazon.com/videos/72541

SC.OS/Cloudforge https://w.amazon.com/bin/viewrev/AWS_SCM_OPS_SUPPORT_FAQ/WebHome?rev=71.1#HReceivingorReturningonCFPlatform

SERVICES: Confirmation of Service and Approval for Payment Once the invoice is processed, the PO Owner receives an e-mail from an automatic Oracle workfow requesting the verification and approval for payment. The payment will only be performed once the approval is given. In case there is no response from the PO Owner, the workflow is escalated.

The payment is triggered only after the Confirmation of Goods Receipt (3-way match) or Service approval.

If the invoice is on Hold due to missing receipt/approval, an automatic e-mail is sent to the user/approver

requesting action.

https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/SA-AP.aspx https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/SA-AP.aspx https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/SA-AP.aspx https://broadcast.amazon.com/videos/72541 https://w.amazon.com/bin/viewrev/AWS_SCM_OPS_SUPPORT_FAQ/WebHome?rev=71.1#HReceivingorReturningonCFPlatform

Vendor Invoicing Cancellation PO Requestors: validate all PO and vendor invoice information in order to avoid incorrect remittance. If an error was identified after the invoice was issued, request the vendor the immediate proof of cancellation of the invoice.

Confirmation, Approval and Payment (2 of 3) https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/SA-AP.aspx

If:

  • You are unsure of the invoice data
  • The material doesnt match what was ordered
  • There are any inconsistencies with the purchase NEVER confirm the receipt of a Good (3-way match) because of potential compliance issues

ALWAYS keep a close communication with the vendor in order to require any necessary corrections or cancellations on time. There is a DEADLINE FOR CANCELLATIONS according to local regulation.

https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/SA-AP.aspx https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/SA-AP.aspx https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/SA-AP.aspx

Invoice Receipt & Validation The Invoice Receipt team will verify, validate and ingest all data related to the invoice received by the Vendor versus the PO that was created by the PO Owner.

Payment If all previous steps were correctly followed, your vendor should expect the payment on the agreed due date. The vendor can view the payment status in Payee Central.

For Internal use: Payee Central Training Guide Link See pages 43-45 at the link

If there is any issue, a Ticket will be created and adressed to the PO Owner containing the issue description to be solved. The Payment will be kept On Hold until the issue is resolved.

Confirmation, Approval and Payment (3 of 3) https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/SA-AP.aspx

Most Common PO Issues and How to Solve

Defect Name Description Root Cause What to Do (TT resolving) How to Prevent This Issue Long Term Solution

The negotiation with the Vendor

have inconsistencies.

(1) PO Requestor must ensure what is

the correct one (invoice or PO);

(2) If the invoice is correct and the PO is

incorrect, add funds to the PO;

(3) If the PO is correct and the Invoice is

incorrect, ask the vendor to cancel the

invoice and send the proof of

cancellation immediately and trough the

same TT;

PO requestor to validate a

preview of the invoice with the

Vendor before its submitted to

AP mailbox

None. PO and invoice

must match.

The PO has only enough funds for

the net purchase amount.

Since Brazil system requires the full

amount in the processing, the user must

add funds to cover the taxes and

additional charges.

PO requestor to validate a gross

price preview with the Vendor

before to use as reference for

the PO creation

Being analized through

Volcano. To be

confirmed.

There was a previous invoice

issued against the PO, but it was

wrong/cancelled and should not

be paid. The PO is consuming

funds that cannot be reversed due

to system limitations.

(1) Immediately send the proof of

cancellation of the previous invoice

trough the same TT;

(2) Corp AP will analyze case by case and

define action path to the PO Requetor

throught the TT

Always keep close control of all

invoices your Vendor is sending

Amazon. If there is any wrong

invoice, always request

immediate proof of

cancellation to the Vendor and

inform Corp AP team (within

same month of the original

invoice, preferably)

Being analized through

Volcano. To be

confirmed.

Happens when the PO does not

have enough budgets to process

the payment. The invoice

amount (or sum of invoices

issued against the PO) is more

than the total PO approved

fund.

Defect Name Description Root Cause What to Do (TT resolving) How to Prevent This Issue Long Term Solution

Missing PO Number

Missing GL String

Incorrect/ Invalid Location

Happens when the PO or invoice

location are different, or it

doesn't match with the GL String

Location.

The PO and invoice location

information was not properly

validated before the negotiation

or the GL String was not prior

verified by a Finance POC.

(1) PO Requestor must ensure what is

the correct one (invoice or PO);

(2) If the invoice is correct and the PO is

incorrect, correct the PO information;

(3) If the PO is correct and the Invoice is

incorrect, ask the vendor to cancel the

invoice and send the proof of

cancellation immediately and send it

trough the same TT;

GL String with a Finance POC.

None. This requirement

will be kept.

PO Closed

Happens when the PO is already

closed by the Requestor and

cannot be used to process any

more invoices.

If all invoices were already issued

to the PO before closing it, the PO

requestor didn't create a new PO

and updated the Vendor with the

new correct PO number.

(1) Re-Open the PO and add funds so the

invoice can be processed;

(2) OR Create a new PO and inform Corp

AP in the TT

Always monitor your POs and

ensure the Vendor mentions

the correct one in the invoice

None. This requirement

will be kept.

Incorrect PO / GL String

Happens when the PO don't

refer to the same Vendor in the

invoice, or the GL String is not

correspondent to the correct

expense account x product type

(1) The PO Requestor didn't select

the correct supplier number to

create the PO;

(2) OR the Vendor issued the

invoice from the wrong branch;

(3) AND the PO requestor didn't

select the correct GL String for the

specific product type

(1) PO Requestor must ensure what is

the correct one (invoice or PO);

(2) If the invoice is correct and the PO is

incorrect, correct the PO;

(3) If the PO is correct and the Invoice is

incorrect, ask the vendor to cancel the

invoice and send the proof of

cancellation immediately and send it

trough the same TT - and issue a new

correct invoice

PO requestor to validate a

preview of the invoice with the

Vendor before its submitted to

AP mailbox. Also validate the

GL String with a Finance POC.

None. This requirement

will be kept.

doesnt mention the PO number

(or GL string - in PO exempt

cases) and Corp AP cannot match

the invoice to the proper

approved budget.

The Vendor was not informed or

forgot to add the mandatory

information in the invoice.

Inform the PO number or GL String (if PO

exempt) in the TT

None. This requirement

will be kept.

reference (or GL string) is

mandatory to be referenced in

the invoice and always send

the updated PO copy to the

vendor.

received by a Vendor in the

onboard was not completed.

Vendor Manager send the Vendor

Onboard invitation to the Vendor and

ask them to complete the onboard

steps.

verify the correct supplier

number exists for the Vendor's

branch before asking them to

send invoices to Amazon

mailbox.

Most Common PO Issues AP HOLDS: QTY REC COUPA

How is the QTY REC hold resolved in Coupa? wiki: https://broadcast.amazon.com/videos/164520

  1. The requester must search for the PO to receive.

Most Common PO Issues AP HOLDS: QTY REC COUPA

  1. Click on the truck Icon

  2. Choose the line, quantity and date you want to receive and save the changes.

Most Common PO Issues QTY REC SC.OS/CLOUDFORGE

How is the QTY REC hold resolved in SC.OS/Cloudforge?

Wiki: https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/ARN_Logistics_-_Receiving_POs_in_Cloudforge_Procurement/

Most Common PO Issues AP HOLDS: PO OVERBILLED

Note: In Payee Central Hold is described as "PO Overbilled" and in Oracle as "Max Ship Amount. It also adds "Qty Ord", which is released at the same time as the Po Overbilled hold.

Most Common PO Issues AP HOLDS: PO OVERBILLED COUPA

How is the PO OVERBILLED hold resolved in COUPA?

Video Explaining adding funds to PO https://broadcast.amazon.com/videos/164031

Step by Step: 1-Select your name on the top

2-Select Activity

3- Then Select Orders

4- Provide PO in search

5- Select PO

6- Scroll down to Bottom you will find Request change.

7-Click on Request change.

8- Scroll down to Bottom you will Find Add Line

9-Select Add line. Once you provide the details( like Description, Qty, amount Need by date, category, invoice matching type)

10-click on Submit change request

Once the funds are added to the PO, and the holds team gets notified we proceed to correct the matching in Oracle in order to release the hold.

Critical Vendors

Confidential

Critical Vendors (1 of 2) https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/Critical_vendor_creation/

WHO IS A CRITICAL VENDOR?

A Critical Vendor can be defined as vendors who as a result of non/late payment of invoices could impact Amazon by:

causing any of our buildings/office spaces to be unfit and/or unsafe for use

causing reputational damage to Amazon or result in non-negotiable penalties/fees.

disturbing traffic to Amazon websites or impairing our commitment to deliver customer orders on time.

risk of service interruption affecting core operations

TYPES OF CRITICAL VENDORS LATAM:

Utility (Gas / Electric / Water / Waste / Etc.)

Telecommunication (Voice Service / Data Circuits / Transit or Transport / Etc.)

Building Rent / Lease / Colocations (https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/Dglenny%40/Training/CoLo/ )

Employee Benefits ( Employee Benefits like Insurance, Health care, Meal passes & Relocation charges etc.)

https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/Critical_vendor_creation/ https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/Dglenny%40/Training/CoLo/

Critical Vendors (2 of 2) https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/Critical_vendor_creation/

CRITICAL VENDOR SUPPLIER ONBOARD

The Critical Vendor Supplier Onboard must follow the general steps in Payee Central.

Exceptions: Government Critical Vendors. Check below:

Non-Governmental Critical Vendor Onboard: Vendor Managers are responsible for sending the invitation to the Vendors via Payee Central.

Governmental Critical Vendor Onboard: Vendor Managers must fill NSQ Form and attach supporting offical documentation.

For more information, check LATAM Wiki https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/Latam_Critical_Vendors_Guide/

https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/Critical_vendor_creation/ https://w.amazon.com/bin/view/Latam_Critical_Vendors_Guide/

Other topics

Confidential

Other Vendor Onboarding Methods

Confidential

What are the other methods & systems used outside of Payee Central and when they are applicable

NSQ The NSQ process was in place before Payee Central rollout. It is still ONLY valid for NGO (Non Governmental

Organizations) and Public Sector payments (such as Critical Vendors). DO NOT set up a regular vendor creation via NSQ.

NSQ Form & Instructions: https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/NSQ.aspx

Contracting with NGOs: https://legal.amazon.com/sites/LegalTeams/InternationalConsumerLegal/LiBra/Pages/ngos.aspx

To request a Vendor Creation via NSQ, open a ticket in the following CTI: C Accounts Payable Vendor Maintenance T Payee Set-up I Payee Setup by NSQ LATAM ---

https://inside.amazon.com/en/services/finance/accountspayable/Pages/NSQ.aspx https://legal.amazon.com/sites/LegalTeams/InternationalConsumerLegal/LiBra/Pages/ngos.aspx

Importation of Services

Before placing an importation order, be aware of:

  • Taxation rules based on the destination country

  • Withholding Tax rules by country

  • COUPA / SC.OS/Cloudforge Purchase Order placement requirements

  • The PO currency MUST match the invoice currency

https://policy.amazon.com/procedure/8314

https://policy.amazon.com/procedure/8314

I'm just wondering why it was sent to me through microsoft teams

2025-08-23T04:35:39.881640Z system

2025-08-23T04:35:39.905649Z assistant

That training deck most likely came through Microsoft Teams because Amazon (and a lot of big enterprises) push out mandatory compliance and process refreshers using Teams as the broadcast channel.

Heres why it would land with you:

  • Role-based targeting Since youre in RME/PMO/WHS, you fall into a group that sometimes needs to understand corporate procure-to-pay rules (even if you dont directly raise POs every day). Theyll push the training file to everyone in that org or cost center through Teams.
  • Distribution efficiency Teams is often used as a broadcast hub for decks that arent tracked in official LMS (like Embark/Learn). It gets around email bloat and ensures you at least see the file.
  • Audit trail Sending through Teams (and storing the file in the channel) creates a lightweight record that training was provided in case Finance or Legal ever audits.
  • Cross-functional exposure You may not be an AP person, but knowing how POs, receipts, and services approvals work matters if you ever touch Coupa/Cloudforge, interact with vendors, or request capital/parts.

So in short: it wasnt randomits pushed broadly so you know the guardrails, even if you wont use every detail daily.

Do you want me to strip that big deck into just the pieces actually relevant to an RME Tech 2 / Ops support role so you dont drown in finance jargon? That way, youd know exactly why you were looped in.
